addCheckpointSignature(uint256,bytes32[].details: If adding the signature leads to reaching the threshold, then the checkpoint is removed from `incompleteCheckpoints`

params.height: - the height of the block in the checkpoint
params.membershipProof: - a Merkle proof that the validator was in the membership at height `height` with weight `weight`

commitCheckpoint(((uint64,address[]),uin.details: this method is called by the corresponding subnet actor.     Called from a subnet actor if the checkpoint is cryptographically valid.

params.checkpoint: The bottom-up checkpoint to be committed.

params.membershipRootHash: - a root hash of the Merkle tree built from the validator public keys and their weight
params.membershipWeight: - the total weight of the membership

pruneBottomUpCheckpoints(uint256).details: `retentionHeight` is the height of the first incomplete checkpointswe must keep to implement checkpointing. All checkpoints with a height less than `retentionHeight` are removed from the history, assuming they are committed to the parent.

params.newRetentionHeight: - the height of the oldest checkpoint to keep

addCheckpointSignature(uint256,bytes32[].notice: checks whether the provided checkpoint signature for the block at height `height` is valid and accumulates that it

commitCheckpoint(((uint64,address[]),uin.notice: submit a verified checkpoint in the gateway to trigger side-effects.

pruneBottomUpCheckpoints(uint256).notice: Set a new checkpoint retention height and garbage collect all checkpoints in range [`retentionHeight`, `newRetentionHeight`)

typeDescriptions.typeString: function (address) view returns (bool,struct Subnet storage pointer)

function (struct IpcEnvelope calldata[] calldata,struct Subnet storage pointer)
function (uint256) view returns (bool,struct BottomUpCheckpoint storage pointer)
function (struct QuorumMap storage pointer,uint256,bytes32[] memory,uint256,bytes memory)
function (struct SubnetID memory,struct IpcEnvelope memory[] memory)

documentation.text:
@notice submit a batch of cross-net messages for execution.
 @param msgs The batch of bottom-up cross-network messages to be executed.
